page.title: 03 Church of St. Mary,Wilby
page.content: SThe church of St. Mary is the oldest building in the village,dating back to the reign of King John in the early {13th century.} It stands on the side of a hill away from the main road. It is worth stopping the car and walking up the road to look more closely at its interesting features. The first thing to catch your eye will probably be the magnificent tower with its striking flying buttresses which support the octagonal spire. At the lower end of the tower you will notice four imposing gargoyles and the large pinnacles which are at each of the four corners. Inside there is an attractive nave with a south arcade dating from the {14th century.} You should note the plain stone font which is medieval, the attractive rood screen which separates the tower and the nave and the{ 17th century} pulpit.
